grossSalesExplain: Gross sales = Subtotal + Ship + Tip + Taxes Collected
netPaymentExplain: Revenue (Net payment) = Gross sales - Discount - Refund
cogsExplain: Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) is the direct costs attributable to the production of the goods sold in a company. This amount includes the cost of the materials used in creating the good along with the direct labor costs used to produce the good.
handlingFeesExplain: Handling fees are the costs associated with the handling of goods, including the cost of labor, packaging, and shipping.
transactionFeesExplain: Transaction fees are fees that a merchant must pay every time a customer makes a purchase with a credit card. These fees can vary depending on the credit card company and the merchant account provider.
grossProfitExplain: Gross profit = Revenue - COGS - Handling fees - Shipping costs - Transaction fees
totalCustomCostExplain: Custom Costs are the costs associated with the production of goods, including the cost of labor, tax, advertising, and other expenses.
roasExplain: ROAS = Total Revenue / Ad Spends. ROAS stands for Return on Ad Spend. It's a digital marketing metric that measures how much revenue a business generates for every dollar spent on advertising.
poasExplain: POAS = Gross Profit / Ad Spends. POAS (Profit on Ad Spend) is a marketing metric that measures the profitability of an ad campaign by focusing on the net profit earned for every dollar spent on advertising.
totalTaxExplain: Taxes Collected is the amount of taxes that a business collects from its customers on behalf of the government. This amount is typically a percentage of the sale price and is added to the total cost of the goods or services sold.
netProfitExplain: Net profit = Gross profit - Taxes collected - Custom costs - Ad spends
totalCostsExplain: Total costs = COGS +  Handling fees + Shipping costs + Transaction fees + Custom costs + Ad spends
